channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @DBashIdeas I’d rather see an original Yerushalmi, but that’s just me.

This looks interesting. https://t.co/DjBrHWUdCK
From the Abstract: “The German conquest of the Kingdom of Poland in 1915 not only instated a new political regime, but also brought about social misery on an unprecedented scale….
“Especially in larger cities, the poor segments of the population were made homeless or cramped into tiny apartments and suffered from hunger and disease. From 1915 outbreaks of typhus occurred in major cities, often found amongst the Jewish population….
“The German occupiers forcefully responded by fumigating houses, quarantining suspected cases, and forcing thousands of families into delousing facilities. These measures particularly targeted Jews as German medical officials identified them as the carriers and spreaders…
“some of them characterized typhus itself as a ‘Jewish disease’. In an effort to prevent the spread of the disease to Germany and to protect the German Volkskörper, Polish Jews – for the fact that they were Jews – were from 1918 onwards barred from crossing the border…
“thousands of Jewish migrant workers in German industry were arrested and deported. The article examines both the political and the medical context in which these policies were employed and analyses Jewish responses to both the spreading of the disease and the German policies….
The article “shows the close connection between health policy and antisemitic and nationalist ideological narratives and projects, and identifies this racialization of disease as a key moment in the development of German antisemitism.”
Read the full article here: https://t.co/dqEZI2PaEq
@DBashIdeas Nothing rare on display as far as I can tell. :-(
@EladNehorai Just one question for you. https://t.co/1vlvAsFzmo
@adamselzer Finally, the Committee will address the question some of us never stopped asking: What did @dick_nixon know and when did he know it?
Trying to capture an infinite scroll page from https://t.co/wKGR8tFTSA, and the resulting PDFs seem to demand an infinite amount of memory (over 16 gig) when opened. Any tips on how to do this?
@YehudahMirsky Thanks for the reminder! Time to buy myself a birthday present.
For those who want to read the full 137 page lawsuit against my alma mater, I have you covered. https://t.co/eAykPRq56d
@jamesdnicoll Consider this a vote for reviewing the Del Rey and Carr collections.
@EladNehorai “Which side are you on?” was a very true statement.
@EnBuenora @SethCotlar No surprise that in the wake of liberal activism, the Gambling Commission was hanging on by the skin of its teeth.
@yourfriendbird7 Might want to get a second opinion from a vet, hypothetically speaking.
@EladNehorai https://t.co/W1ZetYLQV7
Remember: If you see “big news” sourced to an account you never heard of, check before you retweet. https://t.co/kikPy7UTUX
Spoiler: Organized Christian fanatics. https://t.co/4hQRR0mrO2

Wow. Beautifully written and designed account of an astronomical mission to Australia earlier this month, which set out to capture Pluto's shadow -- to learn more about its mysterious atmosphere. https://t.co/DLWvLaMpus
@tcarmody @sirosenbaum Song? Do the whole freakin’ musical!
@peterhimmelman Time to dig up the set list from the Bottom Line show I saw you at on a Tu b’Shvat roughly in that era.
New Peter Himmelman song dropped. https://t.co/8ivH6pwcdW
Interesting, but true lovers of Israel will weight for the always wise Rabbinical Council of America to weigh in. https://t.co/x7kf1kXZvK

@trekonomics The right doesn’t understand why the left is able to prevent them from enforcing blasphemy laws. “Why do you hate God?”
@trekonomics As Thomas clarified last week, the natural order is that of the 17th century.

@KFreund22 @MagisterCalvert @scalzi @ann_leckie I noticed it in Ancillary, which was of course the point (and very challenging to its translators into more gendered languages like Hebrew.) I never noticed it in Kaiju.
@IvesKurtzer @DBashIdeas @tabletmag Self adhesive? Or appropriate flavored glue you need to lick?
@datadivajf Very different from the movie, though they have a couple scenes in common. A lot of it is about empathy — a key (though undernoted) PKD theme.
@benclaywolf I’d love it!
